title: IS_NUMERIC
description: Returns TRUE if the provided string contains only Unicode digits (0â€“9); otherwise, returns FALSE.
examples:
IS_NUMERIC("123")
-- Returns TRUE because "123" is a valid numeric string.

IS_NUMERIC("1.23")
-- Returns FALSE because "1.23" includes a decimal point.

IS_NUMERIC("-45")
-- Returns FALSE because the leading minus sign ("-") is not a digit.

IS_NUMERIC("+78")
-- Returns FALSE because the leading plus sign ("+") is not a digit.

IS_NUMERIC("12%")
-- Returns FALSE because the percent sign ("%") is not a digit.

IS_NUMERIC("World")
-- Returns FALSE because "World" is not a valid numeric string.

IS_NUMERIC(Price_String__c)
-- Evaluates whether the field 'Price_String__c' contains a value that can be converted to a Decimal.
-- Returns TRUE if it is numeric; otherwise, returns FALSE.
